text: Job’s Eighth Speech: A Response to Eliphaz
Then\f + \fr 23:1 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Job answered and said,
“Even today my complaint \add is\add* bitter;
my hand is heavy in addition to my groaning.
⸤O that⸥\f + \fr 23:3 \ft Literally “Who shall give” \f* I knew and \add that\add* I might find him;
\add O that\add* I might come to his dwelling.
I would lay \add my\add* case ⸤before him⸥,\f + \fr 23:4 \ft Literally “to his face” \f*
and I would fill my mouth \add with\add* arguments.
I want to know \add the\add* words \add with which\add* he would answer me,
and I want to understand what he would say to me.
Would he contend with me in \add the\add* greatness of \add his\add* strength?
No, but he himself\f + \fr 23:6 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* would give heed to me.
There an upright person could reason with him,
and I would be acquitted forever by my judge.
“When I go forward, ⸤he is not there⸥,\f + \fr 23:8 \ft Literally “and there is not he,” or “and he is not” \f*
or\f + \fr 23:8 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* backward, I cannot see him.\f + \fr 23:8 \ft Hebrew “and I cannot see him” \f*
⸤When he works⸥\f + \fr 23:9 \ft Literally “At his working” \f* \add on the\add* left, ⸤I cannot perceive⸥\f + \fr 23:9 \ft Literally “and I cannot see” \f* \add him\add*;
he turns to \add the\add* right, but\f + \fr 23:9 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* I cannot see \add him\add*.
But he knows ⸤the way that I take⸥;\f + \fr 23:10 \ft Literally “way with me” \f*
he tests me—I shall come out like gold.
My foot has held on to his steps;
I have kept his way, and I have not turned aside.
\add From\add* the commandment of his lips, indeed\f + \fr 23:12 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* I have not departed;
I have treasured the words of his mouth more than my daily food.
“But\f + \fr 23:13 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* he \add is\add* ⸤alone⸥,\f + \fr 23:13 \ft Literally “as one” \f* and who can dissuade him?
And ⸤whatever he desires⸥,\f + \fr 23:13 \ft Literally “his inner self desires,” or “his soul desires” \f* ⸤indeed⸥,\f + \fr 23:13 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* he does \add it\add*.
For he will carry out ⸤what he appoints for me⸥,\f + \fr 23:14 \ft Literally “my portion,” or “my allotment” \f*
and many \add things\add* like these \add are\add* with him.
Therefore, I am horrified because of his presence;
\add when\add* I consider, I tremble\f + \fr 23:15 \ft Hebrew “and I tremble,” or “then I tremble” \f* because of him.
Indeed,\f + \fr 23:16 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* God has made my heart faint,
and Shaddai has terrified me.
Indeed, I have not been silenced ⸤because of darkness⸥,\f + \fr 23:17 \ft Literally “from the face of darkness” \f*
and because of me he\f + \fr 23:17 \ft Or “it” \f* conceals thick darkness.
